page.title: 02TABRUMS FARM
page.content: Comprises 390 acres, present owners have farmed it for 47 years as a mixed farm. Growing barley, wheat, rape,and potatoes. 4 years ago, 80 acres was drained for grass which feeds 50 beef cattle Hereford Charolais. Each year, 6 cows are purchased at two years old. Before the cows can be served for the first time by the bull, they have to be served by a hired Hereford bull because Charolais calves are too big for first time mothers. Additionally, turkey farming starts on 19th July with 1000, day old chicks, increased on 1st September to 1500. They own a 300 H.P.tractor which cost Â£60,000 and ploughs 80 acres in 1 day, 4 times the average. They also have twelve stables and barns. One barn holds 1000 tons of grain. It is said that the farm has been there since the Norman times, so it was probably in the Domesday Book.
